reason?'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-08 11:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

proxies can be configured globally in docker service, also in docker_common_option variable.

Why glance need a proxy?'}, {'account_id': 17272, 'date': '2018-06-08 13:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> proxies can be configured globally in docker service, also in
 > docker_common_option variable.
 > 
 > Why glance need a proxy?

Eduardo,

This is a very similiar change that was applied to the magnum container with commit #9369ad127cb70b4f79c8e7308be153757810a7ee

We do not want to burn the proxy settings into our containers during the build process but want to be able to configure this subsequently.
In the case of glance we want to be able to import images from outside the corporate network.'}, {'account_id': 17272, 'date': '2018-06-12 10:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> reason?

This method for adding proxy settings to the glance container allows us to do in specific way at deploy time. The method you suggested: https://docs.docker.com/network/proxy/
adds proxy setting for all containers, which we would like to avoid.
Adding proxy settings at build time is also something we don not want to do.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-06-12 13:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
config proxy settings inside glance_api container

Adding the capability to configure settings for http_proxy https_proxy
and no_proxy inside glance_api container. This is required when import
images from external http resources behind a proxy.

Co-Authored-By: Paul Bourke <paul.bourke@oracle.com>
Closes-bug: #1775815
Change-Id: I85661f04311d5671adecc84c470f2e4db07cfe1d

[{'created': '2017-03-13 09:43:21.000000000', 'message': "New GLOBAL_INSTALL_TEST_REQS global parameter

The test-requirements are installed system wide instead of
in virtual environments when they are run via tox.
That's why, for example, the compilation of ovs is broken
due to the introduction of a new test requirement to nova.
The parameter disables to install test-requirements
of all components.

Change-Id: Ibab4f6a00611b31ccdcc65d3f724d55d34b148f9
Closes-Bug: #1671144
"}]
commit_message:
New GLOBAL_INSTALL_TEST_REQS global parameter

The test-requirements are installed system wide instead of
in virtual environments when they are run via tox.
That's why, for example, the compilation of ovs is broken
due to the introduction of a new test requirement to nova.
The parameter disables to install test-requirements
of all components.

Change-Id: Ibab4f6a00611b31ccdcc65d3f724d55d34b148f9
Closes-Bug: #1671144

'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29: Patch Set 28 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-29 19:35:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29: Code-Review-2

I would prefer to not add any CLI functionality corresponding to the POST /allocations REST API command.

The POST /allocations REST API command is a total hack that isn't meant for regular users (it's only meant for system users to split/adjust a previous allocation during a migration/move operation.

My advice is don't even advertise the functionality as a CLI command."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-29 20:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30: Patch Set 29 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-29 20:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31: Patch Set 30 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-07-02 07:35:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

> I would prefer to not add any CLI functionality corresponding to
 > the POST /allocations REST API command.
 > 
 > The POST /allocations REST API command is a total hack that isn't
 > meant for regular users (it's only meant for system users to
 > split/adjust a previous allocation during a migration/move
 > operation.
 > 
 > My advice is don't even advertise the functionality as a CLI
 > command.

As far as I understand all the rest of the commands needs admin credentials by default. So exposing this in the CLI would only expose it to the admin we can trust. Also this API has a nice transactional behavior that makes moving an allocation between consumers safe.
Still at the end of the day I tend to agree with you that using this _from CLI_ seems a really advanced use case. Also I think adding it later (if needed) is possible without too much problems. So we can postpone it (indefinitely). 

Cheers,
gibi"}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-07-02 11:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This was only for the sake of completeness. I happily abandon it.

@Chris: Sorry for missing your earlier comment in April.'}]

This patch does not adhere to the conventions of openstack CLI, because
the API exposed here is so complex I could not find a way to expose it
in the usual way. I went for the seemingly least bad of the following
alternatives:

* Do not list 1.13 as a supported microversion.
* List 1.13 as supported but then throw some explicit error when called.
* Provide some half-assed support. (this patch)

Please note that using 'resource provider allocation create' as usual
for POST requests would be misleading here because this POST method
explicitly supports "[c]reate, update or delete [operations] for
multiple consumers in a single request" as stated in the api-ref.
Instead this patch introduces 'resource provider allocation transact'.

The request body is also quite complex, it could be covered by
introducing command line arguments of the below complexity:

--allocation consumer_id=...,project_id=...,user_id=...,\
             rp=...|VCPU=2|MEMORY_MB=1024,rp=...|VCPU=2|MEMORY_MB=1024
[--allocation ...]

I find this not at all simpler than using JSON therefore we expect the
JSON formatted body because that is at least a well-known format.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-osc-plugin-rocky
Change-Id: I9a050fe7e8d2da327b15414aeccb515984f0b71f

* Do not list 1.13 as a supported microversion.
* List 1.13 as supported but then throw some explicit error when called.
* Provide some half-assed support. (this patch)

Please note that using 'resource provider allocation create' as usual
for POST requests would be misleading here because this POST method
explicitly supports "[c]reate, update or delete [operations] for
multiple consumers in a single request" as stated in the api-ref.
Instead this patch introduces 'resource provider allocation transact'.

The request body is also quite complex, it could be covered by
introducing command line arguments of the below complexity:

--allocation consumer_id=...,project_id=...,user_id=...,\
             rp=...|VCPU=2|MEMORY_MB=1024,rp=...|VCPU=2|MEMORY_MB=1024
[--allocation ...]

I find this not at all simpler than using JSON therefore we expect the
JSON formatted body because that is at least a well-known format.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-osc-plugin-rocky
Change-Id: I9a050fe7e8d2da327b15414aeccb515984f0b71f

commit_message:
Transactionally update allocations (v1.13)

This patch does not adhere to the conventions of openstack CLI, because
the API exposed here is so complex I could not find a way to expose it
in the usual way. I went for the seemingly least bad of the following
alternatives:

* Do not list 1.13 as a supported microversion.
* List 1.13 as supported but then throw some explicit error when called.
* Provide some half-assed support. (this patch)

Please note that using 'resource provider allocation create' as usual
for POST requests would be misleading here because this POST method
explicitly supports "[c]reate, update or delete [operations] for
multiple consumers in a single request" as stated in the api-ref.
Instead this patch introduces 'resource provider allocation transact'.

The request body is also quite complex, it could be covered by
introducing command line arguments of the below complexity:

--allocation consumer_id=...,project_id=...,user_id=...,\
             rp=...|VCPU=2|MEMORY_MB=1024,rp=...|VCPU=2|MEMORY_MB=1024
[--allocation ...]

I find this not at all simpler than using JSON therefore we expect the
JSON formatted body because that is at least a well-known format.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-osc-plugin-rocky
Change-Id: I9a050fe7e8d2da327b15414aeccb515984f0b71f

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (heat)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I0e6f2ecf5f58fb2f6b85274458b06c8682fa4d6d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571741

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 16:42:26.000000000', 'message': "Clarify log in RT._update_usage_from_migration

Now that migration records have UUIDs, this log message
is confusing since it sounds like it's about the migration
record UUID itself, but it's about the instance, and without
context on *what* it's updating, it's more confusing while
tracing a request through the logs. So this clarifies the
actual context of the message and uses the instance_uuid
kwarg for log formatting success.

Change-Id: I5937e6d4c0fb6c3cd6ff2c8b49da35edaba5ef79
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify log in RT._update_usage_from_migration

Now that migration records have UUIDs, this log message
is confusing since it sounds like it's about the migration
record UUID itself, but it's about the instance, and without
context on *what* it's updating, it's more confusing while
tracing a request through the logs. So this clarifies the
actual context of the message and uses the instance_uuid
kwarg for log formatting success.

Change-Id: I5937e6d4c0fb6c3cd6ff2c8b49da35edaba5ef79

commit_message:
functests: Clean up objects better

Since JSON object listings deserialize as unicode, obj['name'] would
hoist *everything* to unicode. If the account or container name was a
byte string, though, it would trip a UnicodeDecodeError.

Change-Id: I2c1932143b78521c6bdcfa48182b475528fc1bb3

commit_message:
SUSE: Add missing Neutron distribution packages

We need the openstack-neutron-l3-agent package in order to be able
to provide floating IPs to the virtual machines. We also need the
openstack-neutron-metadata-agent package which provides metadata
access to virtual machines.

Change-Id: I50998bf4924fa0f8770ad5a15ce79a80718dcc45
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

The dnsmasq process needs to access certain files from directories owned

resulting to the following failures:

Jun 29 07:50:09 dnsmasq[8750]: failed to load names from /var/lib/neutron/dhcp/b245a1a3-6516-4208-931a-3f46d5e99cc3/addn_hosts: Permission denied

Jun 29 07:50:09 dnsmasq[8750]: cannot read /var/lib/neutron/dhcp/b245a1a3-6516-4208-931a-3f46d5e99cc3/opts: Permission denied

As such, we need to make sure that dnsmasq is running as the same user
with neutron.

Change-Id: Id7536ef6e49c93282f1debcb3b2d92452e4aac8b

commit_message:
templates: dnsmasq-neutron.conf: Fix user for dnsmasq process

The dnsmasq process needs to access certain files from directories owned
by the neutron user. However, dnsmasq may be running as a different user
resulting to the following failures:

Jun 29 07:50:09 dnsmasq[8750]: failed to load names from /var/lib/neutron/dhcp/b245a1a3-6516-4208-931a-3f46d5e99cc3/addn_hosts: Permission denied
Jun 29 07:50:09 dnsmasq[8750]: cannot read /var/lib/neutron/dhcp/b245a1a3-6516-4208-931a-3f46d5e99cc3/host: Permission denied
Jun 29 07:50:09 dnsmasq[8750]: cannot read /var/lib/neutron/dhcp/b245a1a3-6516-4208-931a-3f46d5e99cc3/opts: Permission denied

As such, we need to make sure that dnsmasq is running as the same user
with neutron.

Change-Id: Id7536ef6e49c93282f1debcb3b2d92452e4aac8b

commit_message:
Make COPY work with unicode account names

Since account might include a newline, we must expect that Destination-Account
and X-Copy-From-Account come in quoted.

Make sure all locals and req.path_infos are unquoted and all headers and
paths to make_subrequest are quoted.

Change-Id: Idaa51076391e5cba53fbf3e1185bfd0eaa300448

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 10:56:51.000000000', 'message': '[placement] Support forbidden traits in API

In a new microversion (1.22) expose support for processing
forbidden traits in GET /resource_providers and GET
/allocation_candidates. A forbidden trait is expressed as
part of the required parameter with a "!" prefix:

    required=CUSTOM_FAST,!CUSTOM_SLOW

This changes uses db query code adjustments already present
in the code that was guarded by a flag. If the currently
requested microversion matches 1.22 or beyond that flag
is True, otherwise False.

Reno, api-ref update and api history update are include.
Because this microversion changes the value of an existing
parameter it was unclear how to best express that in the
api-ref. In this case existing parameter references were
annotated.

commit_message:
[placement] Support forbidden traits in API

In a new microversion (1.22) expose support for processing
forbidden traits in GET /resource_providers and GET
/allocation_candidates. A forbidden trait is expressed as
part of the required parameter with a "!" prefix:

    required=CUSTOM_FAST,!CUSTOM_SLOW

This change uses db and query processing code adjustments
already present in the code but guarded by a flag. If the
currently requested microversion matches 1.22 or beyond
that flag is True, otherwise False.

Reno, api-ref update and api history update are included.
Because this microversion changes the value of an existing
parameter it was unclear how to best express that in the
api-ref. In this case existing parameter references were
annotated.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits

Change-Id: I43e92bc5f97db7a2b09e64c6cb953c07d0561e63

commit_message:
Removing options in configure-tempest

The following options are being handled now by python-tempestconf
* compute-feature-enabled.attach_encrypted_volume
* compute-feature-enabled.console_output

So, this is no longer required.

Change-Id: I5c3f1e008d6a9c4fa53a2c085039255f41a059ee

subject: Bump pypowervm min to 1.1.15
messages:
[{'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-06-29 18:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-29 20:54:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We don't do this in the requirements project anymore.  We bump lower-constraints.txt in the project itself."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-29 20:58:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

<more> So we added the lower-constraints job [1] but didn't actually add our own lower-constraints file - we're using nova's.  So we could either propose this bump to nova's l-c (and justify it there) or figure out a way to override it for pypowervm in nova-powervm.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555964/"}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-06-29 22:42:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, you're right, and we can figure that out in nova-powervm. But I still think the global min ought to be bumped to 1.1.15 since no project is using something lower."}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-06-29 22:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-30 00:08:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Um, so I'm pretty sure the lower-constraints file in the requirements project is entirely obsolete at this point.  (Why hasn't it been removed?  Dunno.)  I'll abstain for now and let others chime in."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-06-30 03:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-07-02 06:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 18:45:31.000000000', 'message': 'Bump pypowervm min to 1.1.16

1.1.16 is required for a proposed PowerVM virt driver change [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573837/

Change-Id: Icc070ab9c34f3b086d0801bc7cc372390f601f3a
'}, {'created': '2018-06-29 22:42:25.000000000', 'message': 'Bump pypowervm min to 1.1.15

There are only 2 projects using pypowervm (nova and nova-powervm)
and both are using min 1.1.15 so this changes the global min to
match.

Change-Id: Icc070ab9c34f3b086d0801bc7cc372390f601f3a
'}]
commit_message:
Bump pypowervm min to 1.1.15

There are only 2 projects using pypowervm (nova and nova-powervm)
and both are using min 1.1.15 so this changes the global min to
match.

Change-Id: Icc070ab9c34f3b086d0801bc7cc372390f601f3a

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the Notify transport
in place of the rabbitmq values.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variable for Notify to defaults
* Update url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Change-Id: I1c2e844c4c7a2256087bcc4521f970ca8e8c6b16

commit_message:
Add openshift API to haproxy LB configuration

This is to enable our existing haproxy & vip management to work as an
external loadbalancer for openshift when it's deployed as part of the
overcloud.

Change-Id: I04a7dd49949b27238d595911c58815f8f8a4e7e9

commit_message:
Move test-vars into overrides file

Using an in-role test-vars.yml file is an old pattern, and
this role clearly never got the pattern update. This patch
fixes that.

Change-Id: Iac3afc77db87d245e99c0deb5c1bf3ec02fc881a

of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'barbican_db_setup_host'

commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'barbican_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable barbican_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I6257a172cf52e61cb8219f3698c17821270c3ffb

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be

commit_message:
Ability to build container against docker swarm

Add a decode=True option during call to dockerAPI in order
to build container against recent docker swarm.

Closes-Bug: #1779460
Change-Id: I48f041e7ed9dd5a5f410b4eaa081f6f013119d17

[{'created': '2018-06-28 14:46:23.000000000', 'message': 'Remove etag from Bios

Previously implemented etag will not work as intended. The property
@odata.etag will never be populated for BIOS resource. etag value
should come from HTTP headers.

At the moment sushy does not support retrieving ETag from headers,
so this is removed for now.

Change-Id: I7a6ebaac3d4f9a8a722aad32dfaec69153e7bd3a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove etag from Bios

Previously implemented etag will not work as intended. The property
@odata.etag will never be populated for BIOS resource. etag value
should come from HTTP headers.

At the moment sushy does not support retrieving ETag from headers,
so this is removed for now.

Change-Id: I7a6ebaac3d4f9a8a722aad32dfaec69153e7bd3a

commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'masakari_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable 'masakari_galera_address' which
has been used for a long time, but never documented. A bunch of unused
variables have also been removed.

Change-Id: I6c1e4e32681cbb592f6daa805501031bb84e6e0c

commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'zun_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable 'zun_galera_address' which
has been used for a long time, but never documented. A bunch of unused
variables have also been removed.

Change-Id: Ic1e3c870a220f67cc5220a1dbc644d8bf47b0f16

 > they always fail (I guess in a follow up patch). It seems to be
 > related to FIPs note being reachable, so perhaps we are missing
 > some devstack configuration regarding FIPS, similarly to triggering
 > the next commands:
 > $ sudo ip link set br-ex up
 > $ sudo ip route add 172.24.4.0/24 dev br-ex
 > $ sudo ip addr add 172.24.4.1/24 dev br-ex

DF Gates fail due to a known bug, related to how they apply SG rules. OVN one seems to be a different one, even if the root cause is totally different. commit_message:
Split .zuul.yaml into smaller files

This commit splits .zuul.yaml into smaller yaml files inside .zuul.d
repo for easier handling.

Partially-Implements: blueprint zuulv3-native-gates
Change-Id: I73ac4381eaaf14d515eb45c7020881247428e33a

[{'created': '2018-06-29 22:33:36.000000000', 'message': "Restart after plugins or policies have changed

To avoid every run of the role causing a restart of rabbitmq services,
move the restart task until after the tasks for configuring plugins and
policies so that 'rabbitmq_plugin' and 'rabbitmq_policy' are registered.

Change-Id: If7aeeab81a2b8dc722d460b1dba8e65f63285b10
"}]
commit_message:
Restart after plugins or policies have changed

To avoid every run of the role causing a restart of rabbitmq services,
move the restart task until after the tasks for configuring plugins and
policies so that 'rabbitmq_plugin' and 'rabbitmq_policy' are registered.

Change-Id: If7aeeab81a2b8dc722d460b1dba8e65f63285b10

commit_message:
Small change of doc title for the drivers

As some drivers such as ilo, irmc, oneview were changed from
term "drivers" to singular. This patch updates the remaining
drivers.

Change-Id: If9ec87743d29bb36e19452bdbf969b57a7c0464e

commit_message:
Add option for default pip package install

Add an option to define a default set of python packages to install
within a virtual environment. This can be used to install a package
wihin a virtual environment that may be outside of a normal package
list but for a given service.

Change-Id: Iace13b8b4156b0aa6a919cf2b1f3a0c4376a74ee
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove zuul v2 shim

There is absolutely no chance that zuul will be reverted
back to v2, so let's remove the extra code.

Change-Id: I4010515bd867761b0c7fca4e4d93f8320eaa608f

graph (vnffg), vnffg descriptor, network service (ns) and ns
descriptor actions

[{'created': '2018-06-05 14:44:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loop variable name for nested loop

The HAProxy service management did not work because the loop variable
"item" was used in a nested loop within an include. Because of this the
haproxy Ansible module acted on an inexistant HAProxy backend.
Unfortunately the module does not throw an error in this case.

The issue is fixed by using loop_control/loop_var in the inner loop to
use another loop variable name.

Change-Id: Ia9d23f8861b53eadd7d4eff4a68683ebcda37dc2
'}, {'created': '2018-06-07 15:06:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loop variable name for nested loop

The HAProxy service management did not work because the loop variable
"item" was used in a nested loop within an include. Because of this the
haproxy Ansible module acted on an inexistant HAProxy backend.
Unfortunately the module does not throw an error in this case.

The issue is fixed by using loop_control/loop_var in the inner loop to
use another loop variable name.

Change-Id: Ia9d23f8861b53eadd7d4eff4a68683ebcda37dc2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix loop variable name for nested loop

The HAProxy service management did not work because the loop variable
"item" was used in a nested loop within an include. Because of this the
haproxy Ansible module acted on an inexistant HAProxy backend.
Unfortunately the module does not throw an error in this case.

The issue is fixed by using loop_control/loop_var in the inner loop to
use another loop variable name.

Change-Id: Ia9d23f8861b53eadd7d4eff4a68683ebcda37dc2

commit_message:
Port rally plugins to use proper modules

Sometime ago, all OpenStack related stuff moved from the main repository
to the separate one - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack .
All further development and maintance will be done only in a new
repository. As for first major release, the structure is not changed, so
only imports should be changed.

This commit includes the following unrelated change to
pass the gate.
----------------------------------------
Add dummy docstrings to avoid Sphinx 1.7.x warnings

We need to workaround this locally because:
- It's unclear how long os-vif patch [1] will take
  to be merged.
- While Neutron patch [2] has been merged, docs build on
  gate is using released versions of dependencies.

The idea was taken from keystone. [3]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577028/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577029/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578121/

Related-Bug: #1771092
Change-Id: I2d125ce2251473f896fc251b8fa51cfa29721850
----------------------------------------

Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>
Depends-On: I3446ccd5a36cb686282e85a9ea210d1723da1fef
Change-Id: I796e247bcbafc9c5b6d14e30a52e936b16157b8d

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I12967d5f5e707efe2b271b28bc7ea4b40e7f1c15

subject: Use notification listener pools
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-07-02 07:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15843, 'date': '2018-07-02 07:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

* ipmi-test http://52.27.155.124/ipmi/579473/1 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-07-02 08:29:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree, it's better to set it. 

But hardcoding it will break rolling upgrade, and oslo.messaging will still continue to push things on default pool anyways. If no consumer listen for the default pool the queue will just grow infinitely.

About configuration, I think you're wrong, the configuration is parsed at this stage."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 07:24:31.000000000', 'message': "Use notification listener pools

specifying pools for notification listeners is an approach alternative
to specifying multiple topics for notification emitters (and supscribing
to those in notification consumers). It allows easier splitting of
notification listening services and ensuring notification delivery to
every service without changing configuration of notification emitting
services.

Unfortunately we can not specify the pool name in config (as it is not
parsed yet at that stage), so we hardcode the listener pool name to
'ceilometer-agent-notification' and use try/except to deal with those
oslo.messaging drivers that do not support pools for notification
listeners (currently only 'amqp1' does not support it, while
'rabbit'/'kombu' and 'kafka' do support it).

Change-Id: Ide5abb964efbe14d1f2cbaa822a699afc1055786
"}]
commit_message:
Use notification listener pools

specifying pools for notification listeners is an approach alternative
to specifying multiple topics for notification emitters (and supscribing
to those in notification consumers). It allows easier splitting of
notification listening services and ensuring notification delivery to
every service without changing configuration of notification emitting
services.

Unfortunately we can not specify the pool name in config (as it is not
parsed yet at that stage), so we hardcode the listener pool name to
'ceilometer-agent-notification' and use try/except to deal with those
oslo.messaging drivers that do not support pools for notification
listeners (currently only 'amqp1' does not support it, while
'rabbit'/'kombu' and 'kafka' do support it).

Change-Id: Ide5abb964efbe14d1f2cbaa822a699afc1055786

commit_message:
Delete the unused port 35357

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

Change-Id: I8d694669fdb8a1133acd807da50c767b9e64b561

commit_message:
Document containers system config options

Additionally, note the docker0 CIDR should not be in conflict
to any of the defined networks in the deployment topology.

Depends-On: I9b3e729ba48811415106c9fa460cd5a677067fb7
Change-Id: Iae66440ff5fe7a8cc9f8547e61239df1db487dfd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Hide Attribute Registry property in Bios

Make Attribute Registry private until decide how to expose this in
user-friendly way.

Change-Id: I45ced95546460cfa3b82e8fcf8170bd2c0614544

commit_message:
storage_vnx_pool_name is incorrect for VNX cinder driver.

Correct option is storage_vnx_pool_names, so environments and puppet
service yamls need to be changed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572720/
Closes-bug: #1775752

Change-Id: I98ec997847443673b49552d1223238bc9da03cf4

stat /usr/bin/ansible: no such file or directory

Fix the issue to call ansible directly, to consider both cases.

commit_message:
common: fix ansible location

When deploying on arm64, common reports error:
stat /usr/bin/ansible: no such file or directory

The reason is ansible is installed to /usr/local/bin/ansible
rather that /usr/bin/ansible
Fix the issue to call ansible directly, to consider both cases.

Change-Id: Ie90bd9c4d7d3a4b7b0aef884351cb58ed13ebd11
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>
Signed-off-by: Zhangfei Gao <zhangfei.gao@linaro.org>

Run image prepare with --verbose

This will be useful for debugging CI timing issues with logging of
individual image operations.

commit_message:
Add glance auth information to ironic.conf for communication

This adds the necessary config for ironic to communicate with
glance for image storage and retrieval.

Change-Id: Iec5d83715d0dcd83e61bb369f42353efac97e6d0
(cherry picked from commit 6a5f4d7f4ea1f3210e49a5e0ea6a5eac6e33020a)

commit_message:
Upgrade ansible-lint

After yaml upgraded ansible-lint is failing at

TypeError: unbound method construct_mapping() must be called with Constructor instance as first argument (got Loader instance instead)

Change-Id: I52502209d6a6cdac7cc50743046c7050b17bad48

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I1108bfeb4a82fb1b41e3eb135088940c052ce016
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit 2f21d410d9a00e1e38843062777f78bb95a0f0e0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 10:41:24.000000000', 'message': "Enable mutable config in Masakari

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Masakari delegates making
this call to oslo.service, so how do we switch?
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by passing a
parameter, which this patch does.

This allows Masakari to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. We should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config and sending SIGHUP.
Also in this patch configuration parameter
'retry_notification_new_status_interval' is marked as mutable.

Part of bp:mutable-config

Change-Id: Icf4438b98420eb0e9d35a19cf88831f359c74fe5
"}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Masakari

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Masakari delegates making
this call to oslo.service, so how do we switch?
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by passing a
parameter, which this patch does.

This allows Masakari to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. We should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config and sending SIGHUP.
Also in this patch configuration parameter
'retry_notification_new_status_interval' is marked as mutable.

Part of bp:mutable-config

Change-Id: Icf4438b98420eb0e9d35a19cf88831f359c74fe5

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained project
to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Also adjust requiremenst to past the gate checks.

Change-Id: If7a0ebd9cca26cb67eb2ec9036d0aa2693fdffbf
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove redundant message about openstack plugins

In process of deprecating and removing in-tree OpenSTack plugins, the
proper warning message was added to make the process as friendly as
possible.
After these plugins were removed, the warning message become redundant.

Change-Id: I429ff7e862e947ffd6ef1087f347a5d8d7494601

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 00:23:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add different upload cleanup behaviours

By default, images left over from upload operations are deleted from
the local docker, however there are cases where this is not desirable:
- when installing an undercloud, deleting the images then
  re-downloading from the undercloud repository wastes time
- when developing with a workflow where you do not want local images
  to be deleted ever (to save time, or preserve local image changes)

Change-Id: Id844aa2fa5ee20ad264b2fada75fa6cffdc1e307
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
'}]
commit_message:
Add different upload cleanup behaviours

By default, images left over from upload operations are deleted from
the local docker, however there are cases where this is not desirable:
- when installing an undercloud, deleting the images then
  re-downloading from the undercloud repository wastes time
- when developing with a workflow where you do not want local images
  to be deleted ever (to save time, or preserve local image changes)

Change-Id: Id844aa2fa5ee20ad264b2fada75fa6cffdc1e307
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 00:01:49.000000000', 'message': 'Make account ACLs work with unicode in user/account names

Change-Id: I37a97bb9d039a963c7cc57bd97876d0ec2134cf1
'}, {'created': '2018-06-01 23:56:01.000000000', 'message': "Make ACLs work with Unicode in user/account names

There were two separate complications:

  - Account ACLs are stored as JSON, so they were getting deserialized
    to Unicode. That's fine for ASCII names (as u'a' == b'a' under py2),
    but not arbitrary Unicode (as u'\u1234' != u'\u1234'.encode('utf8')
    for both py2 and py3). So, under py2, encode all account ACL members
    as UTF-8.

  - Container ACLs are stored as comma-separated values in a header, but
    values may contain arbitrary characters including not only non-ASCII
    Unicode but also commas and newlines. Fortunately, we have precedent
    for using URL-encoding in headers to resolve this. See crypto,
    symlink, dlo, versioned_writes, copy...

Change-Id: I37a97bb9d039a963c7cc57bd97876d0ec2134cf1
Partial-Bug: 1774238
"}, {'created': '2018-06-05 00:56:40.000000000', 'message': "Make ACLs work with Unicode in user/account names

There were two separate complications:

  - Account ACLs are stored as JSON, so they were getting deserialized
    to Unicode. That's fine for ASCII names (as u'a' == b'a' under py2),
    but not arbitrary Unicode (as u'\u1234' != u'\u1234'.encode('utf8')
    for both py2 and py3). So, under py2, encode all account ACL members
    as UTF-8.

  - Container ACLs are stored as comma-separated values in a header, but
    values may contain arbitrary characters including not only non-ASCII
    Unicode but also commas and newlines. Fortunately, we have precedent
    for using URL-encoding in headers to resolve this. See crypto,
    symlink, dlo, versioned_writes, copy...

Change-Id: I37a97bb9d039a963c7cc57bd97876d0ec2134cf1
Partial-Bug: 1774238
"}]
commit_message:
Make ACLs work with Unicode in user/account names

There were two separate complications:

  - Account ACLs are stored as JSON, so they were getting deserialized
    to Unicode. That's fine for ASCII names (as u'a' == b'a' under py2),
    but not arbitrary Unicode (as u'\u1234' != u'\u1234'.encode('utf8')
    for both py2 and py3). So, under py2, encode all account ACL members
    as UTF-8.

  - Container ACLs are stored as comma-separated values in a header, but
    values may contain arbitrary characters including not only non-ASCII
    Unicode but also commas and newlines. Fortunately, we have precedent
    for using URL-encoding in headers to resolve this. See crypto,
    symlink, dlo, versioned_writes, copy...

Change-Id: I37a97bb9d039a963c7cc57bd97876d0ec2134cf1
Partial-Bug: 1774238

messages:
[{'account_id': 19302, 'date': '2018-06-14 03:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-14 03:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-06-14 15:01:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Thanks for the catch and looking after the production value of Glance.

Unfortunately for this change the Images API v1 has been deprecated for long time and we're working hard to remove it in this Rocky cycle. Thus we will not be taking any changes to the v1 code base.

Please don't let this turn you down. We're looking forward to see more contributions from you and would be more than happy to help you getting up to speed with your future patches."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-06-25 10:28:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Yao,

As Erno said, thank you for being interested in Glance.  At this point, you can write a response comment on this review if you disagree, or you can Abandon this review if you agree with what Erno said.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 19302, 'date': '2018-07-02 01:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 03:37:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add image-metadata validation when image copied from external source

When creating or updating an image, there are three sources of an image.
When image is from a file or sended a location, its metadata will be
validated for activation before uploaded to its store. But if the image
is introduced from an external source using copy_from, the validation
procedure seems missing.

This fix is to add the metadata validation procedure for image from
external source.

Change-Id: Iaac8d4526abb053265242773a361a1301c1884d7
'}]
commit_message:
Add image-metadata validation when image copied from external source

When creating or updating an image, there are three sources of an image.
When image is from a file or sended a location, its metadata will be
validated for activation before uploaded to its store. But if the image
is introduced from an external source using copy_from, the validation
procedure seems missing.

This fix is to add the metadata validation procedure for image from
external source.

Change-Id: Iaac8d4526abb053265242773a361a1301c1884d7

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I63198ad06c1ce0ed4e6580582b269fe69842fed8
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit 74561c32007ee4a4cfd56c687e788f704aeb80d8)

commit_message:
Remove ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa for nova

The job is overriding the irrelevant-files which means we end up
running it on nova docs-only changes.

We've moved the usage in-tree to the nova repo and fixed the
irrelevant-files so we don't need this defined in project-config
anymore. The in-tree change to nova will be backported to stable
branches to maintain coverage.

Depends-On: I9435fe84c8dc8a6f35ffb195ddbf71ca34edb242

Change-Id: I09e49512264909f1fa27f5d0e3703cdbb851ae4c
Related-Bug: #1776981

constraints job is already defined locally in vmware-nsx; so should
be updated there instead.

This patch removes the lower constraints job from vmware-nsx global
project config pipeline.

Change-Id: I7f1a32f487c7681b1c68dcf10c6fe3707820c182
'}, {'created': '2018-06-27 19:47:49.000000000', 'message': 'remove lower constraints to vmware-nsx gate pipeline

constraints job to the project config for vmware-nsx. However the

be updated there instead.

This patch removes the lower constraints job from vmware-nsx global
project config pipeline.

Change-Id: I7f1a32f487c7681b1c68dcf10c6fe3707820c182
'}]
commit_message:
remove lower constraints to vmware-nsx gate pipeline

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573386/ added the lower
constraints job to the project config for vmware-nsx. However the
constraints job is already defined locally in vmware-nsx; so should
be updated there instead.

This patch removes the lower constraints job from vmware-nsx global
project config pipeline.

Change-Id: I7f1a32f487c7681b1c68dcf10c6fe3707820c182

commit_message:
Stop running jobs for the release-tools repo

The openstack-infra/release-tools repository is being retired, as
the Release Management Team ceased using it months ago. As a first
step, stop testing new changes for it so that we can replace its
content with a retirement notice.

Change-Id: Ia94fe9fcbffe9a748694290f5cb91b8ca26237b8

commit_message:
drop pypy jobs from cliff

The jobs have been non-voting for a long time and are failing. We
don't seem to have anyone who wants to fix things up so they will
work, so let's turn them off for now.

Change-Id: I8802b41fb312b29d37784cb77818747b7cca2787
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-06-27 19:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-28 04:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-06-29 07:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-02 01:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nIt's often good to follow this sort of thing with a direct revert, and just mark it as WIP, so there's some history at least of wanting to remove it again"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 19:40:30.000000000', 'message': "increase timeout on neutron-lib periodic for vmware-nsx

At present the openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master job for the
vmware-nsx project times out [1]. As a result we can't be sure if the
tests are fully successful or not and this impacts our perdicability
of neutron-lib releases.

This patch bumps the timeout. I'll talk to that team in regards to
slimming their UT suite.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
vmware-nsx/master/openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/0b29ffb/
job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-27_07_08_05_006704

Change-Id: I43589f528c817006ffe7a7d393840ec27cb12ebd
"}]
commit_message:
increase timeout on neutron-lib periodic for vmware-nsx

At present the openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master job for the
vmware-nsx project times out [1]. As a result we can't be sure if the
tests are fully successful or not and this impacts our perdicability
of neutron-lib releases.

This patch bumps the timeout. I'll talk to that team in regards to
slimming their UT suite.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
vmware-nsx/master/openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/0b29ffb/
job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-27_07_08_05_006704

Change-Id: I43589f528c817006ffe7a7d393840ec27cb12ebd

commit_message:
There are no core developers, only core reviewers

We've insisted in the past that "core developers" aren't a thing, so
if we want to avoid continued propagation of that terminology then
we should do our best to avoid using it in Zuul pipeline
descriptions.

Change-Id: Ifbebf824716e4a4d1bab4eb194a8b6e8b4fedd5f

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: Id9554154320aa7986f66119dac2f1f3174583616
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit 4f90fa0866c990bb89ed86cf93403e7120002b27)

ready before running any Exec with this tag.

commit_message:
Describe separate keymaster config file in docs

The use of a separate keymaster config file was previously only
described in the context of the kms_keymaster middleware. This patch
adds a section to the simple keymaster middleware docs.

Change-Id: Ifa3ad9d6e892b81c52df1f6666a9881042ac60bd

commit_message:
Introduce container resize API

Currently, the container resize is
implemented at the PATCH /containers/<container>
This PS seperating container resize (i.e
update cpu/memory of container) from PATCH api

Closes-Bug: #1759458

Change-Id: Ibcf9913b0dd31013abadf1f9eb70c761870a2c84

subject: [WIP] Use igonore_not_found context manager
messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-27 19:55:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-30 15:23:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's probably failing because you've mocked out the client_plugin. The mock default for calling a function passing an exception as an argument is not to raise an exception, but the mock default for a context manager is not to swallow the exception.

On the bright side, once you fix this (ideally by not mocking the whole client_plugin) you'll have test coverage for the actual logic of catching NotFound, which this shows wasn't the case before."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-07-01 20:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add jobs back to zun

The job artifacts, such as playbooks and zuul config, should
be moved from openstack/zun to openstack/zun-tempest-plugin.
Other OpenStack projects (i.e. Neutron) have placed their such
artifacts in the tempest plugin repo, which is proven to be a best
practice.

The jobs relocation consists of three steps:
1. Copy jobs from zun to zun-tempest-plugin with new names
2. Remove jobs in zun
3. Rename jobs in zun-tempest-plugin to restore its original names
4. Add jobs back to zun

This patch is performing step #4.

Depends-On: I6759c46479cde43c0375e15c5170439feb519c05
Change-Id: Icc0aa312a5abac80e9e9b73ff174704accab9e6d

Rename jobs to restore its original names

The job artifacts, such as playbooks and zuul config, should
be moved from openstack/zun to openstack/zun-tempest-plugin.
Other OpenStack projects (i.e. Neutron) have placed their such
artifacts in the tempest plugin repo, which is proven to be a best
practice.

The jobs relocation consists of three steps:
1. Copy jobs from zun to zun-tempest-plugin with new names
2. Remove jobs in zun
3. Rename jobs in zun-tempest-plugin to restore its original names
4. Add jobs back to zun

This patch is performing step #3.

commit_message:
Temporarily remove jobs in zun

The job artifacts, such as playbooks and zuul config, should
be moved from openstack/zun to openstack/zun-tempest-plugin.
Other OpenStack projects (i.e. Neutron) have placed their such
artifacts in the tempest plugin repo, which is proven to be a best
practice.

The jobs relocation consists of three steps:
1. Copy jobs from zun to zun-tempest-plugin with new names
2. Remove jobs in zun
3. Rename jobs in zun-tempest-plugin to restore its original names
4. Add jobs back to zun

This patch is performing step #2.

Depends-On: Iaaae5525de756fd99059caf187ded17f230ca6a4
Change-Id: Ic5e5b0d511908a21818aebae89c403ee47cd2ce4

subject: Temporarily stop booting nodes in vexxhost
messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-07-01 17:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-07-01 17:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-01 17:17:51.000000000', 'message': 'Temporarily stop booting nodes in vexxhost

IPv6 routing issues are causing most jobs to fail due to lack of
connectivity (mostly manifesting as DNS lookup failures). Set
max-servers to 0 for now while the problems are addressed.

Change-Id: I583e3971b77990a23da29d615c22c5433b876249
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily stop booting nodes in vexxhost

IPv6 routing issues are causing most jobs to fail due to lack of
connectivity (mostly manifesting as DNS lookup failures). Set
max-servers to 0 for now while the problems are addressed.

Change-Id: I583e3971b77990a23da29d615c22c5433b876249

messages:
[{'account_id': 28592, 'date': '2018-06-29 20:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-29 20:09:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-10 08:25:52.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor security group & rule take action methods

Add get_attributes internal functions to the security groups and
security groups rules create & set, to allow other plugins to
override only the attributes code and add extensions attributes
without having to rewrite the entire take_action method.

For example see in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393322/
where vmware-nsx adds some extensions to the security group.

Change-Id: Ifcb9164b39bda007acc18a874caac5ee11da190d
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor security group & rule take action methods

Add get_attributes internal functions to the security groups and
security groups rules create & set, to allow other plugins to
override only the attributes code and add extensions attributes
without having to rewrite the entire take_action method.

For example see in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393322/
where vmware-nsx adds some extensions to the security group.

Change-Id: Ifcb9164b39bda007acc18a874caac5ee11da190d

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: I3c0a82105690acedd62f34dd3214f655c0928dc9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Collect entire Browbeat folder

I'm trying to chase down a metadata parsing issue and the version.json
file is in home/browbeat/metadata not home/browbeat/results since the
rest of the folder is just a few python scripts and other log files
I figured collecting the whole thing would be fine.

Change-Id: I36f7b10bcdb803c4c5396aec1a2561f3aee0ecdf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 13:03:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix usage of isotime

The commit I34b12b96de3ea21beaf935ed8a9f6bae2fe0d0bc and
Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e introduced the
deprecated oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() is deprecated
as of 1.6.

The deprecation message says to use the datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens and other public APIs and we can't change it
without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to ec2api.api.ec2utils.

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: Id62fb53264b04a7ea6ae3035a129353c5cfa040a
Closes-Bug: #1461251
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of isotime

The commit I34b12b96de3ea21beaf935ed8a9f6bae2fe0d0bc and
Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e introduced the
deprecated oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() is deprecated
as of 1.6.

The deprecation message says to use the datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens and other public APIs and we can't change it
without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to ec2api.api.ec2utils.

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: Id62fb53264b04a7ea6ae3035a129353c5cfa040a
Closes-Bug: #1461251

commit_message:
Mark LBs in failover PENDING_UPDATE

Load balancers should be in provisioning_status PENDING_UPDATE while an
amphora on the load balancer is being failed over.

Change-Id: I3557b5a1009d7f555860a7c9a6f4abaeb4a12584
Story: 2002067
Task: 19721

commit_message:
Add API alias for '/statuses'

Fixes a neutron-lbaas LBaaS v2 API compatibility issue when requesting a
load balancer status tree via '/statuses'. This patch adds an alias for
'/statuses' to use the same code as '/status'.

Change-Id: I7aebf87c5f48e2e72b1f7f26b95663a861382f36
Story: 2001812
Task: 12547

commit_message:
Add pool session persistence validation

This patch adds validation to the pool session persistence options.
It validates the cookie_name specified and whether that option is valid
for the session persistence type specified.

Change-Id: I2f35a1a267bf2fc35bbb93a7f5390213ca20d1a8

commit_message:
Add default value for name_lower in network_data.yaml to update ServiceNetMap

In Pike and later, the name_lower field in network_data.yaml can be
re-defined to contain a custom network name.  When this is done the
ServiceNetMap field must be overridden to reflect the new name in all
places.  This changes adds a new optional field to network_data.yaml
that should be set to the original default name_lower value.
ServiceNetMap will then be automatically updated and will not need
to be overridden.

This also fixes the VipPort naming for the StorageManagement network
to not use a static value.

Change-Id: I8a238038122288899cef49faf38ea2c2ffc2176b

[{'created': '2018-06-29 09:51:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix token handling for keystone

In order to avoid errors when deploying multiple controller nodes, we
need to deploy credential-tokens from data bags just like we already do
for fernet-tokens. Otherwise each controller would use a different set
of tokens generated locally.

Drop the corresponding calls to keystone-manage, as they are a) not
idempotent and b) generate files that are never used anyway.

Depends-On: Icf0a8f644ddbfa61bfef124a772663e8af4e1f16
Change-Id: Idabc34d101d9fb145a205acedf8f652ebec3ad9f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix token handling for keystone

In order to avoid errors when deploying multiple controller nodes, we
need to deploy credential-tokens from data bags just like we already do
for fernet-tokens. Otherwise each controller would use a different set
of tokens generated locally.

Drop the corresponding calls to keystone-manage, as they are a) not
idempotent and b) generate files that are never used anyway.

Depends-On: Icf0a8f644ddbfa61bfef124a772663e8af4e1f16
Change-Id: Idabc34d101d9fb145a205acedf8f652ebec3ad9f

commit_message:
Fix token handling for keystone

In order to avoid errors when deploying multiple controller nodes, we
need to deploy credential-tokens from data bags just like we already do
for fernet-tokens. Otherwise each controller would use a different set
of tokens generated locally.

Drop the corresponding calls to keystone-manage, as they are a) not
idempotent and b) generate files that are never used anyway.

Depends-On: Icf0a8f644ddbfa61bfef124a772663e8af4e1f16
Change-Id: Idabc34d101d9fb145a205acedf8f652ebec3ad9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-19 01:21:57.000000000', 'message': "Get ctlplane interface config from the subnet

Use get_attr on the server resource to resolve attribute
values from the subnet and pass them to the parameters
'ControlPlaneSubnetCidr' and 'ControlPlaneDefaultRoute'
used in the THT/network/config/* templates.

As the values are now resolved from resource attributes,
this change removes the default for 'ControlPlaneSubnetCidr'
as well as the comment that these values should be overriden
in parameters_defaults. It also removes the parameters from
network-environment templates.

When deploying a routed control plane the network config
templates would previously need to be updated to carry
'ControlPlaneXDefaultRoute', and possibly also
'ControlPlaneXSubnetCidr' parameters (in case the subnet
mask is not the same for all the routed network leafs).
With 4 Leafs in addition to the network local to the
undercloud that is 8 parameters less to place in the
configuration. By getting the values to pass from the
server resource this change reduces the required nic-config
template customisation (reduce the risk of user error).

Partial: bluepring tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Depends-On: I6927f1e142e83df7258e259bffc86819e4cbe881
Change-Id: Ie1022713f3a6d07ddd7c29ed76ef2957deec5941

commit_message:
Get ctlplane interface config from the subnet

Use get_attr on the server resource to resolve attribute
values from the subnet and pass them to the parameters
'ControlPlaneSubnetCidr' and 'ControlPlaneDefaultRoute'
used in the THT/network/config/* templates.

As the values are now resolved from resource attributes,
this change removes the default for 'ControlPlaneSubnetCidr'
as well as the comment that these values should be overriden
in parameters_defaults. It also removes the parameters from
network-environment templates.

When deploying a routed control plane the network config
templates would previously need to be updated to carry
'ControlPlaneXDefaultRoute', and possibly also
'ControlPlaneXSubnetCidr' parameters (in case the subnet
mask is not the same for all the routed network leafs).
With 4 Leafs in addition to the network local to the
undercloud that is 8 parameters less to place in the
configuration. By getting the values to pass from the
server resource this change reduces the required nic-config
template customisation (reduce the risk of user error).

Partial: bluepring tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Depends-On: I947b4e50dccfa1e9751038d0ccd9737123431e89
Change-Id: Ie1022713f3a6d07ddd7c29ed76ef2957deec5941

commit_message:
Fix copy-pasta in quota command descriptions

These seem to have been copied from the blacklist command and don't
make sense for quotas.  They also appear in the openstackclient help
output which is confusing.

Change-Id: Ib5d2c0fd7da8cb18e230d84c5f344217ad853da7

commit_message:
Optimise the destroy role by script module

Ansible provide script module to run shell script, The local script at
path will be transferred to the remote node and then executed, so no
need to copy script to remote node and use shell moulde to run it.
this patch optimise it.

Change-Id: If774502b66652f25593cda137cc8a5baefbd9695

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 13:39:56.000000000', 'message': "Replace 'raise StopIteration' with 'return'

With PEP 479, the behaviour of StopIteration is changing. Raising it to
stop a generator is considered incorrect and from Python 3.7 this will
cause a RuntimeError. The PEP recommends using the return statement.

More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/#examples-of-breakage

Change-Id: Ib27581fccbbf14c082fb919d8b6edea1ac83e3c0
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'raise StopIteration' with 'return'

With PEP 479, the behaviour of StopIteration is changing. Raising it to
stop a generator is considered incorrect and from Python 3.7 this will
cause a RuntimeError. The PEP recommends using the return statement.

More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/#examples-of-breakage

Change-Id: Ib27581fccbbf14c082fb919d8b6edea1ac83e3c0

commit_message:
Revert "Add doc build job for Chef OpenStack"

Turns out that this is causing issues with stable branches that do not
yet have a doc/ tree. We'll define the docs builds in the local repo
instead, see [0].

Note that this isn't a clean revert, due to the removal of
"system-required" that has happened in the meantime, now the complete
project definition is removed.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/579148

This reverts commit 9c7980078e1101a432d925aea7bcdcc06e9fcffd.

Change-Id: I4e41e0a591e76483b036a3cc8e8c09a4d449a147

commit_message:
Include docker package in mistral-executor image

Most prepare operations are done with docker-py, but some require the
actual docker client. Specifically the tripleo-modify-image role
currently needs to invoke "docker build" directly[1].

Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image/blob/master/tasks/modify_image.yml#L34

Change-Id: I7d5625ab129cc0db40577222ef8a661a2c3845ea

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-06-07 02:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-07 02:43:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

network_id=None is not the same as no-allocation, because the network_id can be None and the port_id can be not None, and we'll attach the port to the server and the port is already on a network. Also, this code has been around for a couple of years now and is well tested already."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-06-07 02:53:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeahï¼ I agree with you. But this None is not this 'none'(string)."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-07 04:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-19509 : FAILURE in 1h 13m 00s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-07 07:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/573073/1/ : SUCCESS in 3h 40m 23s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-07 18:53:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

network_id=None != 'no allocation', i.e. networks='none' during server create. If there is something I'm missing, please report a bug for this and explain why this is wrong and how it causes issues."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-06-30 09:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon.'}]

commit_message:
Fix a logic error in network_request

Because NETWORK_ID_NONE=ânoneâ, the function no_allocate
will always return False

Change-Id: Ifa8693745c43dcfec9b8a25533337326d43f92f1

commit_message:
Add release note about Designate

Apparently this never got done in any of my previous patches, and
it deserves a mention in the release notes.  This is particularly
true since the TripleO configuration is not yet production-ready.

bp designate-support

Change-Id: Ia46108edc985d4c5bfa7a0ec6fdd1fdd6b6b4711

commit_message:
Changes Creation Of overcloudrc File to Call Workflow

This patch updates the code and associated tests to change from
directly calling the tripleo.deployment.overcloudrc action to
calling the tripleo.deployment.v1.create_overcloudrc workflow.

Change-Id: Ib100163a5c9a5d2e6cca6cbc5a186e8e5cbc19ce
Depends-On: I6074b4085b5b77f010f5f2972e7b120aa344f6c5
Partial-Bug: 1640436

commit_message:
Add new undeploy_plan workflow

This wraps the stack delete and handles the message updates to
correctly reflect the deployment status in the clients.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Tomasek <jtomasek@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint config-download-workflows

commit_message:
Fix multinode reproducer for periodic jobs

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572220/ assumed
that the first part of TOCI_JOBTYPE is always
ovb/multinode/singlenode/standalone. This is not the case
with periodic jobs and half the reproducer script
is missing for multinode periodic jobs.

This review removes the 'periodic-' piece of the TOCI_JOBTYPE
string before the split and comparison occurs.

Change-Id: Id5650b43ead7269b6738a8d887ad018e188e517b

[{'created': '2018-06-25 11:41:11.000000000', 'message': "Set undercloud nova notification_format to 'unversioned'

Currently there is no consumer for the versioned notification queue, which
results in the queue growing infinitely large. Until we have a consumer set
the notification format to 'unversioned' only.

Change-Id: I972dd8513c6706d03c328c961bd77eea2672bba2
Resolves-Bug: #1734185
"}]
commit_message:
Set undercloud nova notification_format to 'unversioned'

Currently there is no consumer for the versioned notification queue, which
results in the queue growing infinitely large. Until we have a consumer set
the notification format to 'unversioned' only.

Change-Id: I972dd8513c6706d03c328c961bd77eea2672bba2
Resolves-Bug: #1734185

commit_message:
Enable ARA for the undercloud install

In the latest versions of the undercloud install, ansible is used.
Use ARA to profile the undercloud install steps as driven by TripleO
and save the ARA report to logs/ara_oooq_root/

Change-Id: I2b034b83ba7779d15a5d69263e67d3aea3f631a8

[{'created': '2018-06-27 18:32:17.000000000', 'message': 'Move custom env file to last

Currently if a user specifies a custom set of env files, we apply our
generated network and undercloud settings after these in the deployment
command line. This means we are preventing a user from overriding
anything specified in these.

Change-Id: I1902f91a56822c4219c38aafe5f2baf6b61a0a05
Related-Blueprint: containerized-undercloud
'}]
commit_message:
Move custom env file to last

Currently if a user specifies a custom set of env files, we apply our
generated network and undercloud settings after these in the deployment
command line. This means we are preventing a user from overriding
anything specified in these.

Change-Id: I1902f91a56822c4219c38aafe5f2baf6b61a0a05
Related-Blueprint: containerized-undercloud

commit_message:
Switch to containerized undercloud net config

fs020 is switched to containerized undercloud in [1],
it's failing since then. Switch to undercloud net config
to fix this. fs002 is fixed in [2].

Also change it in other containerized undercloud featuresets.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572215/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576987/

commit_message:
Do not grant caps if pool name is empty

The openstack_keys map can have permissions for an empty pool
which results in an invalid kerying.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic5ae53d9ab52ea5e7c3f75a240a7a7f4bb5632ba
Closes-Bug: 1776987

[{'created': '2018-06-15 19:11:24.000000000', 'message': "Make BIND /var dir persistent

BIND stores dynamically created zones in /var/named by default,
which means that this directory needs to be persistent across
container restarts.  However, we can't just bind mount /var/named
into the container because /var/named is empty on the host, but in
the container the BIND package populates some necessary initial files
in it.

To address this, we can point BIND at /var/named-persistent and
copy all of the initial config from /var/named at container start,
just like we do for other configs.

Change-Id: Ic17fb812468f2eb66d9c348b51dfa73a1f216a70

commit_message:
Make BIND /var dir persistent

BIND stores dynamically created zones in /var/named by default,
which means that this directory needs to be persistent across
container restarts.  However, we can't just bind mount /var/named
into the container because /var/named is empty on the host, but in
the container the BIND package populates some necessary initial files
in it.

To address this, we can point BIND at /var/named-persistent and
copy all of the initial config from /var/named at container start,
just like we do for other configs.

Change-Id: Ic17fb812468f2eb66d9c348b51dfa73a1f216a70

Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

commit_message:
tempauth: Send back url-encoded account names

Taking user_tÃ©st_tester and sending back a link to http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_tÃ©st
may work, but it would be better as http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_t%C3%A9st

This is particularly important if you define something like user_test%ff_tester.

Change-Id: I19d21af94c21fccb4fb835acae231dec424790bb
Related-Bug: 1774238

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

commit_message:
Install packages from centos-release-openshift-origin39

centos-release-openshift-origin39 provides the newest packages for the
3.9 branch that for some reason are not yet available in
  centos-release-openshift-origin.

We need an openshift-ansible package that is recent enough to include
the option to use external openvwitch [1].

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/commit/cc9858ea60.

Change-Id: I6f123cd71a23fb15aaa2005f7397fc98fdaf187a

commit_message:
Fix unit tests under python 3.6

Python 3.6 doesn't like it when you use join on a mock so we need to
pass actual values in when testing.

Change-Id: I028f7cd2934a5b70f70c3582487ec5580c1cb01f
Closes-Bug: #1778903

messages:
[{'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-06-18 07:32:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-18 07:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

please add a release note with the upgrades impact'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:49:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM. Re bogdando's question about upgrades impact, AFAICT there is none, right? This looks like refactoring rather than functionality change. The param names stay the same too. Just everything is done via the Puppet base template now."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-06-19 17:35:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yes, this is a refactoring cleanup, with no functional change and no upgrade impact. But I agree this warrants a release note. The note should state the goal is consolidating glance's NFS setup in puppet/services, and explicitly mention there is no upgrade impact."}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-06-20 12:20:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I view release notes as things that end users should know about to avoid pitfalls and use the software as intended. Refactorings with no change in behavior or interface generally don't need any user attention IMO. Just my 2 cents. If you want to provide a release note anyway though, feel free and i'll re-add +2."}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-06-21 05:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-06-21 05:33:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I was also a bit confused about adding the release note as there is no functional change, so had just added release note in the related puppet-tripleo patch.

So, adding a release note with deprecation section, as it's just a cleanup."}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2018-06-21 06:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Moving glance mount nfs block to puppet glance-api template

Moving nfs mount task from Docker glance-api template to
host_prep_tasks of Puppet glance-api template which would be
common place for both containerized & baremetal case.

Since, all the nfs related puppet-tripleo parameters are no
longer needed after this cleanup, removing those too.

Change-Id: I232577643c26d7eb0162c09b3c394b7f3e161154

commit_message:
Allow custom --bip CIDR for docker options

The default docker0 brige should be normally given a
value that does not conflict to any of the existing
networks' CIDR ranges.

If there is a conflict for the default value `172.31.0.1/24`,
allow users to alter the the docker service startup ``--bip``
option via ``DockerNetworkOptions``.

Change-Id: I9b3e729ba48811415106c9fa460cd5a677067fb7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Prevent Neutron L3 and Metadata agents from running when using OVN DVR.

When using the DVR OVN environments, Neutron metadata and L3 agents could
be left running on the overcloud compute nodes. This patch explicitly
nullifies the DVR versions of those Heat resources to ensure they are
disabled.

Change-Id: I575c0d438a65ce24ee6cb75fec1b95a418e875b1

commit_message:
Include --xattrs when creating the undercloud backup.

We need to use --xattrs when running the backup, otherwise
swift objects after the restore won't be accesible.

(cherry picked from commit bd11ebccfe21f4c0a1833b6afb2c2bc040f6696f) 
Change-Id: I62e5488c78c95368f6b6b967a5504ff3478f1fce
Closes-Bug: 1778215

commit_message:
Add option for user to enter password

Add the --prompt option for the CLI which will cause the user to be
prompted to enter a password. Any password otherwise specified by
--key, --os-password or an environment variable will be ignored.

The swift client will exit with a warning if the password cannot be
entered without its value being echoed.

Closes-Bug: #1357562
Change-Id: I513647eed460007617f129691069c6fb1bfe62d7
