commit_message:
[OVS] Add mac-table-size to be set on each ovs bridge

By default number of MAC addresses which ovs stores in memory
is quite low - 2048.

Any eviction of a MAC learning table entry triggers revalidation.
Such revalidation is very costly so it cause high CPU usage by
ovs-vswitchd process.

To workaround this problem, higher value of mac-table-size
option can be set for bridge. Then this revalidation will happen
less often and CPU usage will be lower.
This patch adds config option for neutron-openvswitch-agent to allow
users tune this setting in bridges managed by agent.
By default this value is set to 50000 which should be enough for most
systems.

Change-Id: If628f52d75c2b5fec87ad61e0219b3286423468c
Closes-Bug: #1775797
(cherry picked from commit 1f8378e0ac4b8c3fc4670144e6efc51940d796ad)

subject: DVR: Self recover from the loss of 'fg' ports in FIP Namespace
messages: [{'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-06-27 17:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-27 19:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-06-27 20:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-28 21:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 17:22:58.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Self recover from the loss of 'fg' ports in FIP Namespace

Sometimes we have seen the 'fg' ports within the fip-namespace
either goes down, not created in time or getting deleted due to
some race conditions.
When this happens, the code tries to recover itself after couple
of exceptions when there is a router_update message.
But after recovery we could see that the fip-namespace is
recreated and the 'fg-' port is plugged in and active, but the
'fpr' and the 'rfp' ports are missing which leads to the
FloatingIP failure.

This patch will fix this issue by checking for the missing devices
in all router_updates.

Change-Id: I78c7ea9f3b6a1cf5b208286eb372da05dc1ba379
Closes-Bug: #1776984
(cherry picked from commit 5a7c12f245fd665de5a0364059e4ad918def3e12)
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Self recover from the loss of 'fg' ports in FIP Namespace

Sometimes we have seen the 'fg' ports within the fip-namespace
either goes down, not created in time or getting deleted due to
some race conditions.
When this happens, the code tries to recover itself after couple
of exceptions when there is a router_update message.
But after recovery we could see that the fip-namespace is
recreated and the 'fg-' port is plugged in and active, but the
'fpr' and the 'rfp' ports are missing which leads to the
FloatingIP failure.

This patch will fix this issue by checking for the missing devices
in all router_updates.

Change-Id: I78c7ea9f3b6a1cf5b208286eb372da05dc1ba379
Closes-Bug: #1776984
(cherry picked from commit 5a7c12f245fd665de5a0364059e4ad918def3e12)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 17:22:24.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: FIP gateway port is tagged as DEAD port by OVS with external-bridge

FIP agent gateway port is tagged as a DEAD port by OVS when external
bridge is configured in neutron.

When external bridge is configured, the vlan tag should be removed
after the port is plugged in.

This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I969b9d7e7cef4beff526a2b26de3f1a9f9de4c1c
Closes-Bug: #1778643
(cherry picked from commit b2b42296965d8d339f06e62bd76ff81c0b746777)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: FIP gateway port is tagged as DEAD port by OVS with external-bridge

FIP agent gateway port is tagged as a DEAD port by OVS when external
bridge is configured in neutron.

When external bridge is configured, the vlan tag should be removed
after the port is plugged in.

This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I969b9d7e7cef4beff526a2b26de3f1a9f9de4c1c
Closes-Bug: #1778643
(cherry picked from commit b2b42296965d8d339f06e62bd76ff81c0b746777)

commit_message:
DVR: FIP gateway port is tagged as DEAD port by OVS with external-bridge

FIP agent gateway port is tagged as a DEAD port by OVS when external
bridge is configured in neutron.

When external bridge is configured, the vlan tag should be removed
after the port is plugged in.

This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I969b9d7e7cef4beff526a2b26de3f1a9f9de4c1c
Closes-Bug: #1778643
(cherry picked from commit b2b42296965d8d339f06e62bd76ff81c0b746777)

commit_message:
Downgrade overquota warning

over quota is expected , not something will lead to further issue.
so downgrade to log.info to avoid

WARNING nova.compute.api [x] ram quota exceeded for xxx
tried to resize instance.: OverQuota: Quota exceeded for resources: ['ram']

Change-Id: I4d326249cdec1c0a67be4c3077b0878ae6802f19

sync_guest_time: use the proper errno

In qemuDomainSetTime, VIR_ERR_OPERATION_UNSUPPORTED
is used to report qemu doesn't support it.

[1]: https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/228ae70938d0cb85353e35f744fbc494de619481/src/qemu/qemu_driver.c#L19437

Change-Id: I84ddb9c434625fd4a57a4f54d0856044e1c56f3f

commit_message:
VMware: remove reading resourcePool data

When the compute cluster stats are read we ready the resourcePool.
This information is not used. So we can remove reading this data.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I949a5e805b9d88fcbe802059e9b548446c7fddda

commit_message:
Reduce CoreOS CPU count to 1

It seems nested virt, while much faster, likes to crash due to
what appears to be a SMP issue. So lets try one CPU.

Change-Id: Ibbfd168844524d91927bdd6e67d973e0bd519bf2

commit_message:
Remove direct tagging from manila repositories

Manila still had direct tagging ACLs for manila-test-image
(which was never released) and manila-image-elements.

After making sure that manila-image-elements could be supported
by regular release requests through openstack/releases, let's
clean that ACL up.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/578379
Change-Id: I044bd0cf7aeefcc2cdfc46e0439845e0ad7c9c5c

commit_message:
fix setup.cfg metadata for individual guides

The format of the setup.cfg files is incorrect and the configparser
module under python3 will not parse them. This patch fixes the errors
by properly indenting the list of values for the 'classifier' entry.

Change-Id: I53c999776155e2977ff7247edcbdaead05fe54cf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: change pylint wrapper to let messages be prefixes
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-13 20:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:16:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Confirmed about the 'suggestions' part of newer version of pylint, using the current messages in trove-pylint.config is really an improvement, thanks. Currently trove-pylint.conf is rebuilt by trove-pylint.py, we may have to refine the rebuilding process too with further patches."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Confirmed about the 'suggestions' part of newer version of pylint,
 > using the current messages in trove-pylint.config is really an
 > improvement, thanks. Currently trove-pylint.conf is rebuilt by
 > trove-pylint.py, we may have to refine the rebuilding process too
 > with further patches.

My advice, really, is to do what you can to drop the use of the wrapper. Changes to pylint over time are just going to make maintaining it more work. It looks like there are quite flexible configuration options for disabling some of the warnings/errors that the wrapper is dealing with (especially the cases where PyLint cannot tell that an object has a dynamically generated attribute). Investing a little time in learning how to configure those checks now may save you a lot of time later in tool maintenance."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-06-19 14:19:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Confirmed about the 'suggestions' part of newer version of
 > pylint,
 > > using the current messages in trove-pylint.config is really an
 > > improvement, thanks. Currently trove-pylint.conf is rebuilt by
 > > trove-pylint.py, we may have to refine the rebuilding process too
 > > with further patches.
 > 
 > My advice, really, is to do what you can to drop the use of the
 > wrapper. Changes to pylint over time are just going to make
 > maintaining it more work. It looks like there are quite flexible
 > configuration options for disabling some of the warnings/errors
 > that the wrapper is dealing with (especially the cases where PyLint
 > cannot tell that an object has a dynamically generated attribute).
 > Investing a little time in learning how to configure those checks
 > now may save you a lot of time later in tool maintenance.

Yes, I was also thinking about removing trove-pylint completely, will add this to the todo list(though cannot promise when I could start this, :(). Thanks a lot."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-06-29 01:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 20:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'change pylint wrapper to let messages be prefixes

The messages for many of the errors reported by pylint have been
extended to include "suggestions" (especially in the case of undefined
variables or members). Rather than update all of the individual
messages in the configuration file, just treat the messages as
prefixes.

Change-Id: I1f11c50e39dbd43c4a9b54ccaaccf03f5ff07aca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
change pylint wrapper to let messages be prefixes

The messages for many of the errors reported by pylint have been
extended to include "suggestions" (especially in the case of undefined
variables or members). Rather than update all of the individual
messages in the configuration file, just treat the messages as
prefixes.

Change-Id: I1f11c50e39dbd43c4a9b54ccaaccf03f5ff07aca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Handling type's multiattach extra specs in API task flow

This patch intends to clean up some codes in 'ExtractVolumeRequestTask'
while fix some related bugs:

1. Remove unnecessary codes which retrieve image metadata from glance.
2. Remove unnecessary codes which retrieve type record from database.
3. Fix issue: volume's multiattach attribute will always be False if it's
   created by a multiattach type which is specified in source volume, snapshot,
   image metadata or config file, related patch [1].
4. Fix issue: 'MULTIATTACH_POLICY' will not be validated if multiattach flag is
   specified in the volume type that from source volume, snapshot,
   image metadata or config file [2].
5. Fix issue: Volume type's 'availability_zones' attribute will not be
   recognized if it's specified in source volume or snapshot.

[1]: a32e24ff3e2c3083b42dd3654355f8c101363147
[2]: ff30971d1f7b1f4febdef9358a999017bea2296d
Closes-Bug: #1770671

Change-Id: Ib88eaef44187ec3427c08a6432622f6390dfac75

commit_message:
Adding availabilty zone parameter in backup-restore

Since backup restore function internally calls create volume
and create volume contains --availability-zone parameter,
backup restore should also have --availability-zone parameter

Closes-Bug: #1749888

Depends-On: #574178

Change-Id: Ie3af6caf0df3a51f9470992b7b57e3ad8e16fca7

commit_message:
Adding availabilty zone parameter in backup-restore

Since backup restore function internally calls create volume
and create volume contains --availability-zone parameter,
backup restore should also have --availability-zone parameter

Closes-Bug: #1749888

Change-Id: I44bee4a44b23a9d45455889739dc57b902f610af

subject: Remove $ from commands for better usability
messages:
[{'account_id': 28559, 'date': '2018-06-27 14:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-27 14:48:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-06-28 02:09:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi @Raju,

Thanks for your first contribution on Zun. However, I don't think it is a good idea to remove the $ since it indicates a non-sudo shell which is the information we want to communicate with readers.

This is a good try though. Welcome your further contribution if you find something that can be improved."}, {'account_id': 25695, 'date': '2018-06-29 03:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

@Raju yes, agree with Hongbin that removing $ from command is not relevant.'}]

commit_message:
Remove $ from commands for better usability

This patch removes the prompt sign $ from the commands
to make it easier for developers to copy and run the
commands directly.

Change-Id: I99ffcb854ea400c0c290ea3694b25753dc0f7716

is also run when you run the 'docs' build, so it should get picked up by
the CI automatically.  It renders the docs into doc/build/html/specs.

commit_message:
Move specs under doc/source so they build

Specs were previously under doc/specs and where thus not being rendered
via the docs build process [1].  This patch moves the directory to
doc/source/specs so that'll happen now, and makes minor tweaks to the
documents themselves to clear build errors.

More work should be done at some point soon to split out the appropriate
parts of test-requirements.txt into a doc/requirements.txt.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: I1e2eff09114ef2f2fca883adb454536fb39ab64d

Skip ServerShowV247Test.test_update_rebuild_list_server in nova-cells-v1 job

Another rebuild test that intermittently fails the cells v1
job because of latent races with status changes in cells v1.

[{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-04-08 17:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-10 15:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Charles, thanks for helping on this, I'm also working on mox removal these days and happy to see someone could help.

There are 2 things should be fixed for this patch:
1. change the gerrit topic to "mox-removal"
2. a lot of assertions are removed when migrating to mock, but they should be kept if possible, I just submit another patch for the unitests for databases, almost every assertion in mox is kept there:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560051/'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, @Charles, would you update this patch to address my previous comment, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ack, I will when I get a chance'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-12 12:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Ack, I will when I get a chance

I could also help to update this patch, it would be great if you can help reviewing the updates and the other three patches on this same topic, thanks, :)'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 559584 to mox-removal'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:07:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi, Charles, I updated this patch, it'd would be greate if you can help to review on this, thanks."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-18 05:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The failed tests should not be relevant to this change. Some recently merged patches in Horizon may be the root cause(still need further invesitigation):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560790/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560977/'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-18 08:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-18 08:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 559584 to mox-removal'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-18 08:29:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The failed tests were caused by the removal of table UpdateAction in Horizon, another patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562144/

should fix that. 

Rebased this one onto the fixing patch, otherwise we cannot pass the checking jobs(this is the same situation for the other 'mox-removal' patches, I'll rebase those one if they're approved and fail in the gate jobs)."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-19 07:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-06-16 13:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-06-21 04:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-06-29 01:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 07:58:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit test modifying global state

The ConductorTaskTestCase.test_build_instances test case uses the
RequestSpec class instead of an instance of the RequestSpec as a mock
return value. If this return value is modified during the test that
modification is done on the class and therefore it is visible to any
subsequent test cases running in the same executor. This could lead to
very strange unit test failures.

This patch adds the missing instantiation to the test case.

Change-Id: Iec47a2c12f35bf050852fe728417c9ddff329a44
(cherry picked from commit 6261325dce258b137ac6013433a50a3e9250a98f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit test modifying global state

The ConductorTaskTestCase.test_build_instances test case uses the
RequestSpec class instead of an instance of the RequestSpec as a mock
return value. If this return value is modified during the test that
modification is done on the class and therefore it is visible to any
subsequent test cases running in the same executor. This could lead to
very strange unit test failures.

This patch adds the missing instantiation to the test case.

Change-Id: Iec47a2c12f35bf050852fe728417c9ddff329a44
(cherry picked from commit 6261325dce258b137ac6013433a50a3e9250a98f)

commit_message:
Refactor replicators' statistics

The object replicator has a Stats object instead of a dict, and that
worked out nicely, so this commit changes the DB replicators to have
the same thing and also extracts a base class for the Stats objects.

Having this in place will be helpful for adding multiprocess support
to the DB replicators someday.

The container sharder's stats are a little wonky in this diff; it had
both key/value pairs (inherited from container replicator) and a more
deeply-nested set of stats (its own). The container sharder's
inherited stats are now in a real object, but the sharding-specific
stats are still in a dict-of-dicts.

Change-Id: I529686cdfd054580bf37890432ed10d983b176be

Thanks for the help, folks!'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-27 22:59:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I did a little digging and the official stand is that libvirt-python must always be >= libvirt.so.  Given that and the versions we have:

 * Ubuntu 3.6.0
 * Centos 3.9.0
 * Gentoo  ???
 * SuSE[1] ???


If we can get buy in from Dirk and Matthew that this u-c bump wont break those distros, or find a way to be compatible. then I think we're good to go.  My +1 can be treated as a +2 once we have positive reviews from Dirk and Matthew

[1] I know SuSE used to be the correct capitalisation is it still?  @Dirk?"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-06-27 23:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Gentoo has libvirt 4.1.0 ~4.2.0-r1 4.3.0-r1, 4.1.0 and 4.3.0-r1 are marked stable'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-06-27 23:03:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Use OpenStack infrastructure MariaDB mirrors

We have mirrored provided by the OpenStack infrastructure which
should reduce the amount of network failures with MariaDB.

Also, use nodepool variables so that we use our infrastructure
provided mirrors.

Depends-On: I49a744ee5c41279f4a17bc7d2339d12c3a132026
Change-Id: I81f716f640f6742c787e7aaedfdbf942893142de

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

Change-Id: Id46c2aa56cd5498d022d29cf102dcbd2014c086d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add systemd tags to include role

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

Change-Id: Id46c2aa56cd5498d022d29cf102dcbd2014c086d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-06-27 14:47:57.000000000', 'message': "swift: Use variables from role for syslog users

The role has it's own specific variables for the username and
password for logging so we should use those rather than redefining
them.

Change-Id: I781c901bf0a22790e609600b32eaabb36b82f983
"}, {'created': '2018-06-27 17:41:23.000000000', 'message': "Stop setting a user to the symbolic link

There is no point in setting an owner and group for a symbolic
link for the logs, only 2 roles do those and they cause issues
for systems such as CentOS and require workarounds for SUSE.

All the other roles work fine without them so we don't need to
use those anymore.

Change-Id: I781c901bf0a22790e609600b32eaabb36b82f983
"}]
commit_message:
Stop setting a user to the symbolic link

There is no point in setting an owner and group for a symbolic
link for the logs, only 2 roles do those and they cause issues
for systems such as CentOS and require workarounds for SUSE.

All the other roles work fine without them so we don't need to
use those anymore.

Change-Id: I781c901bf0a22790e609600b32eaabb36b82f983

This patchset drops the empty services folder under
patrole_tempest_plugin. While it is part of the cookie cutter
Tempest plugin setup, it is currently empty and serves no
purpose in Patrole. If in the future we decide to add service
clients there, we can reintroduce the folder. But there is
no purpose in keeping around an empty folder -- it just
increases clutter.

Change-Id: Ibf83a73f5dc2c38d737359221e9974a6562846a6
'}]
commit_message:
trivial: Drop empty services folder under patrole_tempest_plugin

This patchset drops the empty services folder under
patrole_tempest_plugin. While it is part of the cookie cutter
Tempest plugin setup, it is currently empty and serves no
purpose in Patrole. If in the future we decide to add service
clients there, we can reintroduce the folder. But there is
no purpose in keeping around an empty folder -- it just
increases clutter.

Change-Id: Ibf83a73f5dc2c38d737359221e9974a6562846a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 19:55:02.000000000', 'message': 'Update introduction documention page

A lot has changed in Octavia since the parapgrahs this patch touches on
were written. We should encourage operators and end-users to use Octavia
as first-class load balancing solution in OpenStack rather than
misleading new users by recommending them to use Neutron LBaaS with
Octavia as provider driver, at least whenever possible. A note is left,
though, for operators and end-users already running Neutron LBaaS to
migrate either to Octavia or, if not immediately possible, use the
Octavia proxy plugin in neutron-lbaas.

(cherry picked from commit b1b62d3f7c5722a95590c689828a1ae30e65955b)

Change-Id: I2fdceffe9db2a1edf8f327d551279284917b87ab
'}]
commit_message:
Update introduction documention page

A lot has changed in Octavia since the parapgrahs this patch touches on
were written. We should encourage operators and end-users to use Octavia
as first-class load balancing solution in OpenStack rather than
misleading new users by recommending them to use Neutron LBaaS with
Octavia as provider driver, at least whenever possible. A note is left,
though, for operators and end-users already running Neutron LBaaS to
migrate either to Octavia or, if not immediately possible, use the
Octavia proxy plugin in neutron-lbaas.

(cherry picked from commit b1b62d3f7c5722a95590c689828a1ae30e65955b)

Change-Id: I2fdceffe9db2a1edf8f327d551279284917b87ab

[{'created': '2018-06-26 05:57:06.000000000', 'message': "Correct role rerun when using glance with NFS

When using glance + NFS the role deploys everything perfectly the first
time however if the role is executed again it will result in failure due
to some base directories being a mount. This change adds a new variable
which will create a list of all NFS mount points. This list is then used
in the required tasks to ensure we're not attempting to recreate
directories that should already exist and are being used as
mount-points.

Change-Id: Id28176833c0b783c20ee1d2ce71fa0654ccf683e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-06-28 14:47:53.000000000', 'message': "Correct role rerun when using glance with NFS

When using glance + NFS the role deploys everything perfectly the first
time however if the role is executed again it will result in failure due
to some base directories being a mount. This change adds a new variable
which will create a list of all NFS mount points. This list is then used
in the required tasks to ensure we're not attempting to recreate
directories that should already exist and are being used as
mount-points.

Change-Id: Id28176833c0b783c20ee1d2ce71fa0654ccf683e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Correct role rerun when using glance with NFS

When using glance + NFS the role deploys everything perfectly the first
time however if the role is executed again it will result in failure due
to some base directories being a mount. This change adds a new variable
which will create a list of all NFS mount points. This list is then used
in the required tasks to ensure we're not attempting to recreate
directories that should already exist and are being used as
mount-points.

Change-Id: Id28176833c0b783c20ee1d2ce71fa0654ccf683e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.5

This fixes several performance and module issues. One such issue we'll
need resolved can be seen here:
 * https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-extras/issues/1278

Without this fix the `rabbitmq_user` module will stacktrace if the user
password is change.

This corresponds to https://review.openstack.org/578000

Change-Id: Ife9174ffe7a8c285c3201679a3f49a071b857647

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 00:01:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add systemd tags to include role

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

Change-Id: I364362e480d6cb0c1dad0d48f9fc068f817fed45
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add systemd tags to include role

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

Change-Id: I364362e480d6cb0c1dad0d48f9fc068f817fed45
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Added weight for aggregate soft (anti) affinity.

This is similar feature to soft (anti) affinity feature[1] which was
done for compute hosts. In This commit we introducing two new weights:

- aggregate-soft-affinity
- aggregate-soft-anti-affinity

which can be used for scattering instances between two aggregates within
an instance group with two policies - to keep instances within an
aggregate (affinity), or to spread them around on different aggregates.
If there would be not possible to put an instance together on an
aggregate (in case of affinity) or on different one (in case of
anti-affinity), it will be placed in specified group anyway.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/approved/soft-affinity-for-server-group.html

Change-Id: I38f9e0bce5bc58d8b03f562f0de618f1ec38aeb1
Blueprint: aggregate-affinity

commit_message:
Add nodes to group hosts to be checked against aggregation

Currently, only hostnames (which origin from machine, on which compute
service is running, and which belong to the requested group) was checked
against host aggregates. This patch adds also instance_group.nodes to
the set of the keys being a criteria for a search in aggregates.

Change-Id: I87f54b055d2f06f808f2dcdb0a0473e4f744c3e3

commit_message:
Pass hosts or nodes to HostStates update method depending on a driver.

Currently, _get_host_states method in HostManager class will excplicitly
use hosts during updating host states. In this patch we change the
HostManager._get_aggregate_info to return either aggregates using host
or nodes as a key by passing compute object instead hardcoded host.

Because HostManager.host_aggregates_map now can have keys which are
either hosts (which usually origin from compute service hostname) or
nodes (which are UUIDs of ironic nodes, that compute service handle), we
can change IronicHostManager._get_aggregate_info to return aggregate
info using nodes instead of hosts.

Change-Id: Ib84bee8c34d2a42c18acbce131142af5e4933c06
Blueprint: aggregate-affinity

[{'created': '2018-04-06 07:19:17.000000000', 'message': "Added node field for InstanceGroup objects

Currently, there is only a way for getting the information which hosts
belongs for certain instance group. By 'hosts' it means a hostname, on
which compute service is running. In case of bare metal instances, there
is no way to get the information out of instance group object which
ironic nodes are belonging for such group. This patch adds an ability
for fetching such information.

InstanceGroup class now have new field - nodes - and corresponding
method get_nodes, to gather information about nodes  out of instance
objects. Also request spec object was updated to reset new InstanceGroup
nodes field during group population.

Change-Id: I661507962fbacb01c5461e4148c0311230eb3f3b
"}]
commit_message:
Added node field for InstanceGroup objects

Currently, there is only a way for getting the information which hosts
belongs for certain instance group. By 'hosts' it means a hostname, on
which compute service is running. In case of bare metal instances, there
is no way to get the information out of instance group object which
ironic nodes are belonging for such group. This patch adds an ability
for fetching such information.

InstanceGroup class now have new field - nodes - and corresponding
method get_nodes, to gather information about nodes  out of instance
objects. Also request spec object was updated to reset new InstanceGroup
nodes field during group population.

Change-Id: I661507962fbacb01c5461e4148c0311230eb3f3b

[{'created': '2017-12-20 02:32:38.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Support aggregate affinity filters

DO NOT MERGE - Moar tests to come

Adds support for two new server group policies:

 * aggregate-affinity
 * aggregate-anti-affinity

Server groups that are tagged with the aggregate-affinity policy
indicate to the scheduler that instances should be placed on hosts that
share the same aggregate associations. The aggregate-anti-affinity
policy indicates that the scheduler should place instances on hosts that
are NOT associated with the same aggregates.

This functionality is useful for Ironic deployments where (with the
change to allow host aggregates to be associated with compute nodes and
not just service records) Ironic baremetal resource nodes are grouped
together in aggregates that represent racks or power failure domains.
The new aggregate affinity filters allow the caller of nova boot for
Ironic baremetal instances to pack or spread their instances in a
particular rack or power domain as needed.

Change-Id: I9620f5fa3b27ce1746051d2412bbb4de2e678a11
blueprint: aggregate-affinity

commit_message:
Support aggregate affinity filters

Adds support for two new server group policies:

 * aggregate-affinity
 * aggregate-anti-affinity

Server groups that are tagged with the aggregate-affinity policy
indicate to the scheduler that instances should be placed on hosts that
share the same aggregate associations. The aggregate-anti-affinity
policy indicates that the scheduler should place instances on hosts that
are NOT associated with the same aggregates.

This functionality is useful for Ironic deployments where (with the
change to allow host aggregates to be associated with compute nodes and
not just service records) Ironic baremetal resource nodes are grouped
together in aggregates that represent racks or power failure domains.
The new aggregate affinity filters allow the caller of nova boot for
Ironic baremetal instances to pack or spread their instances in a
particular rack or power domain as needed.

Change-Id: I9620f5fa3b27ce1746051d2412bbb4de2e678a11
blueprint: aggregate-affinity

commit_message:
get instance group's aggregate associations

In order to complete the aggregate affinity work, we need a way of
getting the set of aggregate UUIDs associated with any compute node
housing an instance in an instance group.

This patch adds the objects.InstanceGroup.get_aggregate_uuids() method
that does just that.

Change-Id: I5f7d39fcdcffca4b76a3c520ad8093557ef65fef
blueprint: aggregate-affinity

There were a bunch of global variables in nova/scheduler/utils.py that
cached whether or not a particular scheduler filter for a server group
policy was in the enabled filters or weighers list. These variables were
then mocked out with overrides in a functional test which resulted in
hard-to-predict behaviour when attempting to add more filter checks to
the utils.py module.

Just remove the global variables completely along with their mocks in
the functional test. We're essentially caching the results of a strcmp()
which is not useful and ends up causing confusion in the functional
tests.

commit_message:
Remove server group sched filter support caching

There were a bunch of global variables in nova/scheduler/utils.py that
cached whether or not a particular scheduler filter for a server group
policy was in the enabled filters or weighers list. These variables were
then mocked out with overrides in a functional test which resulted in
hard-to-predict behaviour when attempting to add more filter checks to
the utils.py module.

Just remove the global variables completely along with their mocks in
the functional test. We're essentially caching the results of a strcmp()
which is not useful and ends up causing confusion in the functional
tests.

Change-Id: I6e8212e45f9690f4b09b7dcc6e8fc0e511036dad

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-28 21:33:52.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

The spec for this was never approved and there was disagreement at the Rocky PTG [1] on how this was being done (add a new microversion to note that both hosts and nodes can be in aggregates, or add a new node-specific aggregates API, or other). There was also discussion about modeling node aggregates in Placement and then using the placement pre-request filtering stuff for that which has landed in Rocky:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/schedulers.html#aggregates-in-placement

So at this point I'm going to abandon this series to flush it from the review queue, but if the alternatives we talked about at the PTG aren't going to work, we should discuss this again at the Stein PTG. I'm assuming Oath has already backported this to Ocata for their needs anyway.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-rocky-placement"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 18:56:42.000000000', 'message': "allow compute nodes to be associated with host agg

The Compute API allows for a host_name attribute to be specified
along with the aggregate's ID to associate or disassociate that host
with the aggregate. Unfortunately, due to vestigial coupling between the
compute service record and the compute node concept, this meant that
Ironic baremetal resource nodes cannot effectively use the Nova host
aggregate concept to group resource nodes. Instead, only the
nova-compute service(s) that manage those Ironic resource nodes can be
grouped together using a Nova host aggregate. This is less than useful
for Ironic deployments.

This patch does not change the public Compute API for adding or removing
hosts from an aggregate. Instead, what this patch does is look at the
value of the host_name being associated or disassociated, and if that
host_name looks like a UUID, then we assume that the user is attempting
to associate a compute *node* (i.e. an Ironic baremetal node) instead of
a compute *service* host.

This work should pave the way for Ironic deployments to fully take
advantage of Nova server group affinity/anti-affinity and allow
HostAggregate metadata filters to operate on Ironic baremetal nodes in
the scheduler.

Change-Id: Ic7828846148fb365a6d25f97eff117ca4a47e0df
"}, {'created': '2017-12-18 15:55:09.000000000', 'message': "allow compute nodes to be associated with host agg

The Compute API allows for a host_name attribute to be specified
along with the aggregate's ID to associate or disassociate that host
with the aggregate. Unfortunately, due to vestigial coupling between the
compute service record and the compute node concept, this meant that
Ironic baremetal resource nodes cannot effectively use the Nova host
aggregate concept to group resource nodes. Instead, only the
nova-compute service(s) that manage those Ironic resource nodes can be
grouped together using a Nova host aggregate. This is less than useful
for Ironic deployments.

This patch does not change the public Compute API for adding or removing
hosts from an aggregate. Instead, what this patch does is fall back to
looking up compute node records by hypervisor_hostname if a service
record with the supplied hostname parameter cannot be found.

This work should pave the way for Ironic deployments to fully take
advantage of Nova server group affinity/anti-affinity and allow
HostAggregate metadata filters to operate on Ironic baremetal nodes in
the scheduler.

Change-Id: Ic7828846148fb365a6d25f97eff117ca4a47e0df
"}, {'created': '2017-12-18 18:00:43.000000000', 'message': "allow compute nodes to be associated with host agg

This work should pave the way for Ironic deployments to fully take

Change-Id: Ic7828846148fb365a6d25f97eff117ca4a47e0df
"}, {'created': '2017-12-20 02:32:38.000000000', 'message': "allow compute nodes to be associated with host agg

commit_message:
allow compute nodes to be associated with host agg

The Compute API allows for a host_name attribute to be specified
along with the aggregate's ID to associate or disassociate that host
with the aggregate. Unfortunately, due to vestigial coupling between the
compute service record and the compute node concept, this meant that
Ironic baremetal resource nodes cannot effectively use the Nova host
aggregate concept to group resource nodes. Instead, only the
nova-compute service(s) that manage those Ironic resource nodes can be
grouped together using a Nova host aggregate. This is less than useful
for Ironic deployments.

This patch does not change the public Compute API for adding or removing
hosts from an aggregate. Instead, what this patch does is fall back to
looking up compute node records by hypervisor_hostname if a service
record with the supplied hostname parameter cannot be found.

This work should pave the way for Ironic deployments to fully take
advantage of Nova server group affinity/anti-affinity and allow
HostAggregate metadata filters to operate on Ironic baremetal nodes in
the scheduler.

Blueprint: aggregate-affinity

Change-Id: Ic7828846148fb365a6d25f97eff117ca4a47e0df

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 08:33:39.000000000', 'message': "Only query LIMIT instances in local marker cell

Now, If we want to get instance list with specific limit and
marker in multi cell, first, we need find the global marker,
then find the local marker in every cell based on this glabal
marker, next, we get the instances from cells using their own
local marker, finally, we gather the result from all cells.

If the local marker is NOT glabal marker, we will prefix cell's
result with this local marker. So, after prefixing this local
marker, we get **LIMIT+1** instances from every local marker
cells, though we only need LIMIT instances from every cells.

Actually, it makes no difference to the final results, because
we will limit the instances with the global limit at end, but we
get one redundant instance from db in every local marker cell.

This patch try to get the exact number instances from cells.

Change-Id: I1a08db305c06efb4355aded2cafe342723ba38ef
"}, {'created': '2017-11-23 09:40:10.000000000', 'message': "Only query LIMIT instances when list in local cell

commit_message:
Only query LIMIT instances when list in local cell

Now, If we want to get instance list with specific limit and
marker in multi cell, first, we need find the global marker,
then find the local marker in every cell based on this glabal
marker, next, we get the instances from cells using their own
local marker, finally, we gather the result from all cells.

If the local marker is NOT glabal marker, we will prefix cell's
result with this local marker. So, after prefixing this local
marker, we get **LIMIT+1** instances from every local marker
cells, though we only need LIMIT instances from every cells.

Actually, it makes no difference to the final results, because
we will limit the instances with the global limit at end, but we
get one redundant instance from db in every local marker cell.

This patch try to get the exact number instances from cells.

Change-Id: I1a08db305c06efb4355aded2cafe342723ba38ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 18:48:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add live status report to object replicator

The object replicator now has an internal scoreboard that contains
information about the currently-running replication jobs and also has
a socket interface for querying it.

The replicator's status report has things like partition, device,
storage policy, and peer to whom it is pushing for each active
replication job, plus the current stats for the replication pass and
the replicator's PID (to help with strace). It's easy to add more
things; anything JSON-serializable will work.

There's a new CLI tool called "swift-interrogate" that you can use to
query the running replicators. The output is pretty crude at the
moment, but it lets you see what your replicators are doing.

The socket interface uses Unix sockets in /var/run/swift, one per
replicator process, except for the master process in multi-process
mode as that process doesn't replicate anything.

The protocol is length-type-value; values are serialized JSON-RPC 2.0,
and the type is always 1. The type is there in case we outgrow
JSON-RPC.

Change-Id: I16f68dae9123838b87712635f05421d791a3efd8

commit_message:
Add live status report to object replicator

The object replicator now has an internal scoreboard that contains
information about the currently-running replication jobs and also has
a socket interface for querying it.

The replicator's status report has things like partition, device,
storage policy, and peer to whom it is pushing for each active
replication job, plus the current stats for the replication pass and
the replicator's PID (to help with strace). It's easy to add more
things; anything JSON-serializable will work.

There's a new CLI tool called "swift-interrogate" that you can use to
query the running replicators. The output is pretty crude at the
moment, but it lets you see what your replicators are doing.

The socket interface uses Unix sockets in /var/run/swift, one per
replicator process, except for the master process in multi-process
mode as that process doesn't replicate anything.

The protocol is length-type-value; values are serialized JSON-RPC 2.0,
and the type is always 1. The type is there in case we outgrow
JSON-RPC.

Change-Id: I16f68dae9123838b87712635f05421d791a3efd8

[{'created': '2018-06-28 00:00:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add systemd tags to include role

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

Change-Id: I8a007c62e110c96fce4fc687258af0b4ef7b3ab1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add systemd tags to include role

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

commit_message:
Add RBAC tests for security group default rules client

This PS adds RBAC tests for the security_group_default_rules
client, the API for which is here: [0]. It enforces the
following policies: [1]. And the max_microversion for this API
is 2.35 as the API is deprecated from 2.36 onward [2].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#rules-for-default-security-group-os-security-group-default-rules-deprecated
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/policies/security_group_default_rules.py
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#rules-for-default-security-group-os-security-group-default-rules-deprecated

Change-Id: I12c8c6d060ee512741b437202c8be4657bc42c01

With the implementation of system-scope, we need to make sure we
populate scope in the context for a request. This is important
because it will make sure keystone passes system scope information
along to oslo.policy in the same way we pass project scope
information.

This will make it so that oslo.policies `enforce_scope` option does
the right thing when tokens of different scopes are passed in.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530509/
Change-Id: Ib5ac164746f15a5cb5ba63dfa0539be00746989e
'}]
commit_message:
Update context middleware and token models for system

With the implementation of system-scope, we need to make sure we
populate scope in the context for a request. This is important
because it will make sure keystone passes system scope information
along to oslo.policy in the same way we pass project scope
information.

This will make it so that oslo.policies `enforce_scope` option does
the right thing when tokens of different scopes are passed in.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530509/
Change-Id: Ib5ac164746f15a5cb5ba63dfa0539be00746989e

commit_message:
Add systemd tags to include role

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

Change-Id: I3b27d6334078235a0092039d7bf3f146c821380d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add manila-image-elements as release type

The openstack/manila-image-elements repository has a specific
release job, legacy-manila-publishimage-generic. In order to
support release requests for manila-image-elements, we need
to create a specific release model ("manila-image-elements")
where that job is a valid release job. That will allow
manila-image-elements to drop direct tagging ACLs.

Change-Id: Ida32d45c1e5587b98eca5e4ed36880a77a92698e

[{'created': '2018-06-27 14:17:17.000000000', 'message': 'Process for deliverables with no changes

Update PROCESS.rst to include instructions in case a given
deliverable saw no change at all during the cycle. In that
case no release is forced, and a stable branch is created
from the last-available release.

Change-Id: Ida35c588ea3cd191fe24c49d7fae9879b934d432
'}]
commit_message:
Process for deliverables with no changes

Update PROCESS.rst to include instructions in case a given
deliverable saw no change at all during the cycle. In that
case no release is forced, and a stable branch is created
from the last-available release.

Change-Id: Ida35c588ea3cd191fe24c49d7fae9879b934d432

commit_message:
set container variables when needed

Only run container tasks when required to:
1. prior to undercloud
2. prior to overcloud-prep-containers
3. prior to standalone deployment

Closes-Bug: #1777896
Change-Id: I50054a95500747972454305001d34c4c97b71e7f

commit_message:
Remove database configuration

Ceilometer no longer requires or supports a database. Instead
it now forwards everything it collects to the message queue
for collection by the other Telemetry services.

Change-Id: Ib8cb1ca3e0ef81c16a6483d20705fa3b237bbc48

subject: Move database creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-28 13:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-28 19:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 13:35:29.000000000', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'congress_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable 'congress_galera_address' which
has been used for a long time, but never documented. A bunch of unused
variables have also been removed.

Change-Id: Id22bb9c3c3146aee6ccd7462c4a52b0be718ad55
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'congress_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable 'congress_galera_address' which
has been used for a long time, but never documented. A bunch of unused
variables have also been removed.

Change-Id: Id22bb9c3c3146aee6ccd7462c4a52b0be718ad55

Release os-traits 0.8.0

This is needed for nova change
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538498/ to
report standard compute driver capabilities
as traits to placement.

Change-Id: I09b7b02cba1536049b9273a22b6dc94b237e69de
